Instruction: Move an oven rack to the lowest position and preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).

In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until soft peaks form, then gradually add the remaining sugar, continuing to whisk until stiff peaks are achieved. Gently fold the egg whites into the cream and yolk mixture until well combined.
Stir the mixture constantly for about 15 to 20 minutes, until it thickens slightly and coats the back of a spoon.
Remove the double boiler from the oven; let cool for about 10 minutes before transferring the mixture to a blender. Blend until smooth.

In a medium bowl, combine egg whites and 1/4 cup sugar. Using an electric mixer, beat on medium speed until soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining sugar, beating on high speed until stiff peaks form.
Place the ramekins under the broiler for 1 to 2 minutes, until the sugar melts and caramelizes.
Transfer to serving dishes and enjoy!
